title: Lynda - Illustrator CC for Web Design - Aesthetics
description:
This is the third series of the Title Illustrator CC for Web Design, The previous two titles were, Lynda-Illustrator CC For Web Design: Core Concepts, Lynda-Illustrator CC For Web Design: Wireframing.

The Description of this Course
 <a href="
http://www.lynda.com/Illustrator-tutorials/Illustrator-CC-Web-Design-Aesthetics/368389-2.html?srchtrk=index:1%0Alinktypeid:2%0Aq:Justin%2BSeeley%0Apage:1%0As:relevance%0Asa:true%0Aproducttypeid:2" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.lynda.com/Illustrator-tutorials/Illustrator-CC-Web-Design-Aesthetics/368389-2.html?srchtrk=index:1%0Alinktypeid:2%0Aq:Justin%2BSeeley%0Apage:1%0As:relevance%0Asa:true%0Aproducttypeid:2</a> 

Websites don't just need to work great; they need to look great too. Here Justin Seeley shows how to inject your website designs with new lifeÃ¢â‚¬â€using color, typography, graphics, and functional but aesthetically pleasing interface elements like buttons and menus. He'll also help you organize your layers so they are more understandable to developers, file a project library on Creative Cloud, and share your designs on Adobe's portfolio site, Behance.

Topics Include:

Finding color inspiration
Applying color
Choosing the right typeface
Using character and paragraph styles
Optimizing graphics in Photoshop
Placing photos and vector artwork in Illustrator
Creating buttons and other UI elements
Organizing and sharing your project
